channel.title: Apartment Therapy | Saving the world, one room at a time
channel.description: Saving the world, one room at a time

item.title: Mokulock Wood Bricks: The Natural LEGOs
item.description:
Love LEGO but hate plastic? Ambivalent about color and like all your blocks to be the same size? Maybe a set of all-wood interlocking building blocks are what you’ve been looking for. 

More
item.author: Elizabeth Licata

item.title: 4 Fun Ways to Destress at Your Desk
item.description:
Everyone has to deal with stress at one time or another, so having a few tools inside the desk to pull out for a stress-break can be helpful (as well as giving your eyes a break from the computer screen). These are quick, easy, and not to mention fun ways to relax yourself throughout the day.

More
item.author: Jason Yang

item.title: Cammie's Great Green Attic Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Cammie
Location:
Lawrence, KS
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
I love the green floor! Our bedroom is in the attic of a small bungalow-style home and one of our first projects when we moved in was ripping out the dark brown carpet. Underneath was a very low-quality wooden floor, so we had no reservations painting it. Most of the walls in our house are off-the-shelf “ultra pure white,” so the green is a refreshing sea of color.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Leigh's 'One Window Too Many' Renovation
item.description:
What's the incentive to undergo a kitchen renovation? For Kitchn reader Leigh, it was a desire to make the most of the view outside. "Our goal from the beginning was to open up the views by having as many windows as possible and no upper cabinets..."

• Leigh's Kitchen Renovation
  The Kitchn
item.author: Cambria Bold

item.title: Find Your Favorites: Tuesday's Entries — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
We may be nearing the end of our Bedroom Contest but there's still a lot of new entries to see. Check out today's fresh entries and if you like what you see, be sure to click the heart on their post to make them a "favorite" and help move them up on the leaderboard.

  • Brittany's Recharge & Recenter Bedroom
  • Jordan's Lovely Lighting Bedroom
  • Eva's Fresh Air Bedroom
  • Michala's White & Cream Bedroom
  • Jacob's Moody & Enveloping Bedroom
  • Kim's Antiques Sanctuary Bedroom
  • Christina's "Cloffice" Bedroom
  • Ryan's Cloud of Solitude Bedroom
  • Anni's Beautiful Blue Family Bedroom

More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: A Colorful Modern Mix in London — Light Locations
item.description:
If you find yourself thinking, as you browse through these photos, that this home seems a little too good to be true, you're exactly right. This beautiful Georgian townhouse in London is leased for photo shoots through UK firm Light Locations, and it's perfect in the way only a house no one lives in can be. 

More
item.author: Nancy Mitchell

item.title: Anni's Beautiful Blue Family Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Anni
Location:
Saugerties, NY
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
The natural light and the color. We have a few pieces of mid-century furniture so we chose a dark green/blue to really make them stand out. We also have several artists in the family so we are lucky to have a lot of really beautiful original art.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Behind the Scenes with HGTV: Shooting "Home Diaries" with Michele & Ryan Tansey
item.description:
Last week, I had the unique opportunity to go behind the scenes of an HGTV television shoot at our friends Michele and Ryan Tansey's gorgeous (and newly renovated) home. You may remember the Tansey's amazing home and wedding that we wrote about last year!

More
item.author: Andie Powers

item.title: Ryan's Cloud of Solitude Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Ryan
Location:
Denton, TX
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
My style is simplistic and modern with a touch of traditional, so I like to incorporate all my styles into one room that's my own. I'm in love with my bed. It's my fluffy cloud of solitude, the white down comforter is a classic that will never get old. I like neutral colors that I can live with, and contrast, so there's a lot of white tones mixed with dark wood.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Meet the Maker: Ben Medansky
item.description:
We've seen a lot of furniture designers in our Meet the Maker series lately, so it's nice to take a look at the work of ceramicist Ben Medansky. Having worked with other artists, like The Haas Brothers and Kelly Lamb, Ben is now focusing on his own pieces, which range from sculptural to functional. 

More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Daring Decor: Graffiti Walls
item.description: You're tired of solid paint colors and you can't find a wallpaper you really love. If your walls need a kick, and your style is a bit more daring, would you consider grafitti? More
item.author: Kathleen Luttschyn

item.title: New Recipes from The Kitchn
item.description:
The scallops with orzo and that citrusy millet salad are looking mighty fine, especially if you add a square of fresh rosemary focaccia to the bargain. Or maybe braised beef over polenta if you're still in a wintry mood...

• New Recipes from The Kitchn
  The Kitchn
item.author: Cambria Bold

item.title: Christina's "Cloffice" Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Christina
Location:
Belmont, MA
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
My daughter’s bedroom has become a room full of her personality. We recently redesigned it together using colors and accessories she loves. We gutted her closet and made it a cloffice complete with a floating desk and a chalkboard wall, with has been quite the hit with young and old alike.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Mark’s Urban Architect's Loft in Seattle — House Tour
item.description:
Name: Mark
Location: South Lake Union, Seattle, Washington
Size: 680 square feet (plus 150 square foot terrace)
Years lived in: 3 years; Rented

Whether he’s entertaining a group of friends for a home-cooked meal (one specialty is chilaquiles), working on architectural plans at the kitchen table, or relaxing after work with the patio doors open, Mark brings a sense of ease and playfulness to his condo — and there’s always good music playing. Despite having once been in love with crisp lines and modern profiles, he’s now “so over stark modern” and is enjoying having fun with the decor in his centrally located Seattle loft.

More
item.author: Heidi Leigh Johansen

item.title: What Household Tasks Do You Most Love and Hate?
item.description:
We all have harmless little household tasks that infuriate us for no reason. Nobody likes big or messy jobs like taking out the garbage or unclogging drains, but what about changing light bulbs or replacing the toilet paper on its holder? When living with another person it's important to figure out what everyone’s pet peeves are so one person doesn’t wind up with all the tasks he or she hates the most. 


More
item.author: Elizabeth Licata

item.title: Kim's Antiques Sanctuary Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Kim
Location:
San Francisco, CA
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
The rest of my house is colorful, eclectic and multi-layered, but my bedroom is very different in feeling, with gentle colors and accessories. Nothing slick or modern; all the built-in shelves and cupboards are simple and kind of rustic. It's in the back of the house on the top floor, so it's quiet with lots of natural light. It's also my only "room with a view," and I enjoy looking out the corner windows at the cityscape and my neighbor's trees and the birds living in them. My bedroom is definitely a retreat and a sanctuary (almost literally, given all the antique religious figures and art I like to collect!)


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Storage Solutions for Apartment Kitchens — Renters' Solutions
item.description:
One of the most frequently lamented problems in a kitchen is a lack of storage, an issue that can be compounded when it's a rental kitchen and you don't have as many possibilities to customize it to your needs. Even when you can't renovate, here are some ideas taken from some of our house tours and our sister site The Kitchn that can help you make the most of what you've got.

More
item.author: Carolyn Purnell

item.title: Kaitlin's Personal Style Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Kaitlin
Location:
Indianapolis, IN
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
I love that despite living in a rental house, I've learned to make my room a reflection of myself. I've spent the last six months slowly decluttering. Evaluating every item's importance has helped me embrace my personal style instead of trying to force my life into a predesigned aesthetic.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Jacob's Moody & Enveloping Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Jacob
Location:
St. Louis, MO
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
I have a theory that one's bedroom should be a sanctuary from the day to day hectic obligations, work, stressors and general craziness. I prefer a darker- "moody" as it's been referred to- space so that it's relaxing and envelopes me as I retreat into my personal space. I'm a collector of curiosities so I fill it with things that I love or that have been handed down to me as heirlooms that are meaningful. Thankfully, I have a decent walk in closet so that only my aesthetically pleasing pieces are visible and the "clutter" is to a minimum. Until now, I've never really published photos of it because it's a personal space but I love the idea of sharing design elements and ideas within a community such as apartment therapy.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: 12 Favorite Modern Dressers
item.description:
The dresser is the workhorse of bedroom furniture. Use it to store clothes and extra bedding, set one up beside the bed for a convenient bedside table or even push one into the bathroom for a little extra storage. There are a million and one options out there but these are twelve of my favorite modern design dressers.

More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Michala's White & Cream Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Michala
Location:
Brooklyn, NY
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
The best part of my bedroom is waking up in it. The light that filters through the shutters actually inspired the tone of the room and by limiting the colors to varied shades and textures of white and cream, the room feels peaceful and serene no matter what time of day it is. The space is big enough that I never feel crowded and, after a long day in the city, I love that I can come home to a room that is light, feminine, simple and airy. If it weren't for the honking cars outside, I might even forget that I'm in Brooklyn!


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Seth & Allison's Kitchen: The Walls Go Up — Renovation Diary
item.description:
Name: Seth & Allison 
Type of Project: Kitchen/Family Room renovation 
Location: Ventura, California 
Type of building: Mid-Century, multi-level, single family home

The Renovation Diaries are a new collaboration with our community in which we feature your step by step renovation progress and provide monetary support towards getting it done in style. See all of our Reno Diaries here.

Immediately after insulation was installed, the drywall crew came in and hung new drywall throughout the kitchen and family room. This included the new walls that had recently been framed and the existing walls that had been opened up for plumbing, electrical and new windows. 

More
item.author: Guest

item.title: A Renter's Life in Montreal: The Inside Scoop — Apartment Therapy Renters Guide
item.description:
As the world's second-largest French-speaking city, with students galore and a vibrant business center, Montreal has a competitive rental market for the most charming of its apartments. Your best bet for hunting is well before July 1 — that's when the vast majority of leases change hands. Another surprising aspect of Montreal renting: it's illegal for landlords to require a security deposit, key deposit, or anything more than the first month's rent (a far cry from the first month, last month, and security I was accustomed to, coming from New York City). 

More
item.author: Regina Yunghans

item.title: The Duplex, Right Side: Jean & Dylan's Playful, Working Hideaway — House Tour
item.description:
Name: Jean Lee & Dylan Davis of Ladies & Gentlemen Studio
Location: Ballard, Seattle, Washington
Size: About 900 square feet
Years lived in: 5 years; owned (co-owned)

Remember Chika and Jared from the Duplex Part 1? Jean and Dylan make up the other half! Owners of Ladies & Gentlemen Studio, Jean Lee and Dylan Davis live in the right side of the duplex (the studio connects to each home), where they work side by side on their line of textile accessories: R&L Goods.

More
item.author: Andie Powers

item.title: Super Scandinavian: Flag, Swedish Chairs & Nightstand — The Tuesday Afternoon Scavenger
item.description:
Stylish and simple, with minimal lines that make decor feel comfortable and clean. 
  • New York, NY: Swedish Flag - $120
  • Greenville, SC: Tapiovaara Chairs - $2500
  • Madison, WI: 1960s Horse Blanket - $490
  • Homeland, IL: Mid Century Nightstand - $125
  • New York, NY: Fagerhults Lamps - $35

item.author: Dabney Frake
